questions.text: What movie with PIT in its title was made in 1961(starring Vincent Price) and in 1991 (starring Lance Henriksen)?
questions.explanation:
'The Pit and the Pendulum'.

	A great and a not so great adaptation of Poe's classic tale.

questions.text: He wrote, 'Hello Mary Lou', for Rick Nelson in 1961 and had a hit with, 'Only Love Can Break a Heart'?
questions.explanation:
Gene Pitney.

	Gene Pitney hails from Rockville, Connecticut.

questions.text: He was often considered Britain's greatest prime minister, first from 1783 to 1801, and from 1804 to 1806 ?
questions.explanation:
William Pitt the Younger.

	Pitt the Younger led England during French aggression.

questions.text: What American author and educator wrote the best seller, 'Life Begins at Forty', in 1932 ?
questions.explanation:
Walter Boughton Pitkin.

	Life does indeed begin at forty, or so they tell me. What do I know, however, is that I still have another twenty five years to go.

questions.text: Comedienne in over 100 films, from 1917 to 1963 ?
questions.explanation:
Zasu Pitts.

	Among her best works was the 1947 classic 'Life With Father'.

questions.text: What is the major gland of the endocrine system, which is located at the base of the brain?
options: Pity I can't think of another choice, gland
questions.explanation:
Pituitary Gland.

	In human beings, it is about the size of a pea.

questions.text: He won an Emmy in 1979 for directing the TV show 'Barney Miller' ?
questions.explanation:
Noam Pitlik.

	Hal Linden starred as Barney in this very popular series.

questions.text: This film noir, from 1948, starred Dick Powell and Lizabeth Scott ?
questions.explanation:
Pitfall.

	Intriguing look at the American dream gone sour.

questions.text: This volcanic island is in the central south Pacific Ocean, and was first sighted in 1767 ?
questions.explanation:
Pitcairn Island.

	The island was settled in 1790 by mutineers from the British ship HMS Bounty.

questions.text: This movie, also the name of a city, starred Marlene Dietrich and John Wayne ?
questions.explanation:
Pittsburgh.

	Shemp Howard of Three Stooges fame, was also in this movie about the steel business.
